replies.commentBody: You forgot to mention Sidney Blumenthal, 8/10

If everything is so "clear" to you, what do you have to fear from comprehensive investigations into the current administrations ties with Russia and into the extent of Russian interference in our election? The American people deserve answers based on more than your personal interpretation.

Charles

I imagine you think you have been clear here. But trust me, you guys never are, so I'm asking you make the effort.

Just as I wonder what anybody imagines was Obama's plan for using the military you patriots now distrust and despise to crush Texas and let the Chinese Armey saunter in and take over America, I also wonder what you think Obama has in mind by ruining Trump (actually, I kind of get that one), detroying American nationalism, and creating open borders and globalism.

I'm really doubly confused, or maybe triply. Because you all spent the whole campaign shouting that we already have open borders, which even you know we do not. And in a country as deeply divided as you have made this one it would be hard to discern nationalism of any kind.

Anyhow, I would appreciate your attempt to explain the motive and the end result of this massive Obama conspiracy.

Thanks,

your pal John S.

comments.commentBody:
Okay, it's clear: Jarrett recently moved into Obama's Washington DC mansion. Together they walked out of the White House with any intelligence reports they could carry on Republicans to leak to the complicit press and try to ruin the next President. They squash the DNC hopes of Ellison so that their puppet is in control.

Obama and Jarrett are in lock step with the globalism and the open borders movement and they are hell bent to destroy any American nationalism as a way of achieving their goals.
Fantasy.

In all the historical naval fiction about the Napoleonic War period, the crew of a British ship is read the Articles of War once a month. Those, or a suitably updated version should be read periodically to Congress and the administration by the Supreme Court, together with a repeat of their oaths to uphold and defend the US Constitution.

The various articles include a rather harsh penalty: the violator 'shall suffer death, or such other punishment, as from the nature and degree of the offence a court martial shall deem him to deserve.'

The time has come again for such warnings.
As they say, "When you go to bed with Russian Dogs, you wake up with GOP Fleas".

Seems to me that the White House should welcome the appointment of a special prosecutor to independently investigate Mr. Sessions and the Trump-Russia connection, just as Hillary welcomed one's appointment to investigate her emails during the campaign . If the White House doesn't, I suspect the facts "speak for themselves".
This is like a bad political thriller.  America, what happened to you?
So the Russian spy ship lurking off our coast was just theater as I suspected.

Time for trump to decide those Achilles "heel spurs" have resurfaced & require that he resign.

Or else ...

replies.commentBody:
Uh, how is it obvious that anyone who'd try to preserve evidence of possible treason on the part of a Presidential candidate is acting from nefarious motives?

I think we've found the partisan blinders.
And the Rebulicans spent 8 years deliberately "sabotaging" President Obama's Presidency....can you see some irony in your comment?
That doesn't even make sense. To what end other than that this election was a farce?

comments.commentBody: It's adorable how the Times interprets the Obama administration motives as being purely for the good of the country. Obama was/is trying to sabotage the Trump administration. That should be obvious to anyone without partisan blinders.

Given what we have already learned, what might the actual reality be? Is it possible that Trump & Putin now communicate regularly, with Trump clearing all actions with Putin? Is it possible Trump has sworn allegiance to the Russian state? Are we currently living under partial or primary control of the Russian government?

These ideas would have seemed ridiculous not long ago. Now they seem plausible. Certainly Jeff Sessions and Jim Comey won't reveal that Russia is in fact now the de facto ruler of the United States. They facilitated and actively participated in the coup.

In general I am now starting to see why Trump calls the media the "enemy of the American people", why he insists at every moment the media is against him.

He must know more explosive evidence of his ties with Russia is out there and he wants a way to minimize the damage by discrediting the messenger because he cannot discredit the message.

replies.commentBody: So there were no contacts by anybody? Why hide them  and so many other things such as tax returns.

comments.commentBody: When a party is in complete disarray, disappointed and embarrassed by a monumental loss to someone outside the beltway what else can they do but yell....The Russians Are Coming!!!  What a bunch of fools the liberals of this country are.  They should all dress in white so we can point and laugh.

There is just way to much "Russia" about Trump. In 2008, Trump's son said that the business was seeing a lot of Russian money coming in. Then the campaign with Manafort as manager and Carter Page and Roger Stone helping out. Of course Trump's infamous public request for Russian hacking was surreal.
Move to the Trump transition and now administration with Gen. Flynn, Rex Tillerson and now Wilbur Scott all on board. All with ties to either Russian government officials and or Russian money. I am sure my little list isn't complete.
Why all these people associated with Russia? Why are they all close to Trump and working for him now? Because they all have knowledge? Of what?
Show us Trump's taxes, and go from there. This is unacceptable, even by the deplorably low standards that our government now represents.

American intelligence agencies received confirmation from European intelligence agencies and governments on meetings between Trump top aids and the communists.  Those countries couldn't care less if Trump or Clinton won the election.  The input their intelligence gave can be relied on to tell it like it is.  There is no doubt that the Trump campaign and administration are in Russia's pocket.  To deny this is to deny reality.  Living in a fantasy world is OK for those who believe in unicorns and fairies, but for the rest of us we have to face the facts.  The Russian questions MUST be investigated by a totally independent body.
This is horrifying but will anyone stand up and do anything about this? Probably not.  This system seems so devoid of any honesty or any ability to begin to do the right thing.

replies.commentBody: This kind of delusion would be funny if it wasn't so tragic.

Delusion was thinking that Obama wanted to unify the country.

Instead, his Dept. Of Just Us was more divisive than any other.

And before you say "Oh. look at the opposition to Trump!", i'll mention that the media has an overwhelmingly progressive worldview. But you knew that.

comments.commentBody: God Bless President Trump.  This is going to be a great 8 years for America...lots of things to fix, but he has the people in place to get things done.

This whole administration is a fraud.
The GOP is 100% complicit in everything.

replies.commentBody: let me guess where that information about rubles and Russian contacts comes from.  Brietbart?  or one's paranoid imagination?

comments.commentBody: This whole narrative hinges on the Wiki material having influenced the voters (not the election...though that's the claim always cited). Is there really any American with an IQ above the high teens who was surprised by Clinton dirty tricks like stocking the DNC with minions or having Bill's former lackeys get their grubby little mits on some debate questions?  Really?  This stuff didn't move the needle one iota and the story never advanced beyond a curiosity because it was expected. The shock would have been proof that nothing untoward happened where the Clinton's were involved.  And here's another shock: both major campaigns had contact with foreigners, most particularly the presumed victor. The Clinton Rolodex of Russian contacts would put Trump's to shame as would the number of rubles in their respective foundation's coffers.

The fraying threads of this administration's coattails have been caught in the mill now, and it is slowly pulling them in.  Something is up here, and no matter what, we need to ignore the Trump pleads that there is nothing to see... and their efforts to distract by outrageous actions.   Now you see why so much fuss about the press and "anonimous sources"  they know a storm is comming and they are battening down the hatches.  I tried to put in as many parables as i could.

replies.commentBody: So the fact that the Russians hacked the election and trump seems fine doesn't bother you? Yeah blame the liberals.
Does Trump take money? If not, why not release his tax returns. Seems you do not measure with same tools.
That is precisely the ignorance that Trump hopes Americans continue to display.

comments.commentBody:
This is the Establishment trying to derail the new administration by whatever means. Obama turned to be a champion not of the middle class but of the Establishment. From the moment he signed NDAA 2012 on the New Year's Eve - with all its content of unconstitutional detention of Americans on US soil - I knew we had a phony. On January 2 2012 I was with a few others protesting that treacherous piece of legislation in front of the US Court District in Trenton, in freezing weather. And later we found out - thanks to Snowden - that President Obama put the NSA on steroids - figuratively speaking.
I regret very much having supported him in 2008.
Even if Trump folk talked to the Russians, so what? We have all sort of foreigners, even from the Gulf States who helped Clinton by day and Daesh by night. And nothing that Wikileaks revealed was untrue; they just unmasked a bunch of weasels.

If I have followed this revelation on multiple points correctly, there is the present day AG, J. Sessions who was formerly or going back to 2/16 a significant presence in the Trump '16 campaign hierarchy while serving in the the U.S. Senate. He met with Russsian Ambassador, Kislyak who the U.S. Intelligence Community considers both a spy and a recruiter in Washington D.C. "on the sidelines" at the the RNC in July and in his office in Sept... Fast Forward to the Trump electoral win, he is nominated for the AG appointment and undergoes the customary and usual Confirmation Hearings where he apparently denied any contact with any Russians while under oath both verbally and in writing via Sens. Leahy and Franken.
While I'm not sure what the rule of law is for such an offense or what if any prosecutorial advancements might be available, why would fellow GOP Senators (McCain & Graham) be referring to a mere "recuse" in lieu of a total dismissal from present day position as AG? Shouldn't this strike elected U.S. Senators as more a potentially grave Constitutional matter?
What I might gleam from the NYT article here is that there is possibly more interventionist information in the hands of Security Agencies that has yet to be released. As a citizen, I certainly hope that is the case no matter which way the chips might fall...

replies.commentBody: She has made millions from her Russian deals. John Podesta sits on the board of a Russian company. Nobody who chose her as a candidate cared. The double standard of low info voters is incredible.

comments.commentBody: Imagine how the Republicans would react if they learned that Hillary Clinton had been communicating with the Russians and then lied about it.

replies.commentBody:
"The real story is the he Democrats are completely devoid of any new ideas or plans to help America."

OK, name one new idea or plan that der Donaldt has proposed to "help America". One.

Sorry, but racism, hate, bigotry, greed, and religious fundamentalism are all *old* ideas. Try again.

comments.commentBody:
So much smoke for months now. Yet no fire. The whole Russia/Trump connections is all bogus. More #FakeNews

The real story is the he Democrats are completely devoid of any new ideas or plans to help America. Their only play is to de-legitimatize the Trump Presidency in the hope of picking off enough "Never Trump" Republicans and block Trump from implementing his programs and policies.
So the Dems have put all their eggs in the Russia/Putin basket.
And everything about Russia, Trump, and Putin is #FakeNews
That the #FakeNews Putin/Trump conspiracy story has gained so much traction, is just more proof of how biased, corrupt and dishonest the mainstream Media is. The Press truly is the "Enemy of the American People" They are nothing but propaganda wing of the Democratic party. Disgusting.

I was only three years old when Nixon resigned, but I've read a lot about Watergate and this is reminding me more of it with every new revelation. Today's news that GOP leaders are demanding Sessions recuse himself just makes the Watergate comparison more compelling. I also think Sen. McCaskill's quote in today's NYT, in which she noted that she's been on the Armed Services committee for 10 years and never spoke to the Russian ambassador and that ambassadors tend to contact senators on the Foreign Relations committee, not Armed Services, is very interesting.
